section.p: This section provides a quick reference to the block storage requirements of delegate hosts. For more information, refer to the .
cluster hosts need either unformatted block storage devices or partitions, or free space in one or more LVM volume groups.

ul.li: Enter the following command to display information about block storage: lsblk -ap --output=NAME,SIZE,TYPE,FSTYPE,MOUNTPOINT
Enter the following command to display information about LVM volume groups: vgdisplay

section.p: The following storage configuration is recommended for delegate hosts:

ul.li: One local, high-performance device or partition with a minimum of 35GB of storage, formatted with XFS, for the root filesystem.
One local, unformatted, high-performance device or partition with 50GB of storage. A step in this chapter configures the space as an LVM thin pool for Docker data.
